2010.description: Double Rainbow was a viral video filmed by Paul 'Bear' Vasquez.
2010 Haiti earthquake, large-scale earthquake that occurred January 12, 2010, on the West Indian island of Hispaniola, comprising the countries of Haiti and the Dominican Republic.
Born on January 1, 1919, in New York, J.D. Salinger was a literary giant despite his slim body of work and reclusive lifestyle.
During the Iraq War, a Sergeant recently assigned to an army bomb squad is put at odds with his squad mates due to his maverick way of handling his work.

The 2010 Thai political protests were a series of political protests that were organised by the National United Front of Democracy Against Dictatorship (UDD) (also known as 'Red Shirts') in Bangkok, Thailand from 12 March–19 May 2010 against the Democrat Party-led government.

Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act. The Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act, also the Affordable Care Act or colloquially known as Obamacare, is a United States federal statute enacted by the 111th United States Congress and signed into law by President Barack Obama on March 23, 2010.

The 2010 eruptions of Eyjafjallajökull were volcanic events at Eyjafjallajökull in Iceland which, although relatively small for volcanic eruptions, caused enormous disruption to air travel across western and northern Europe over an initial period of six days in April 2010.
The explosion and subsequent fire resulted in the sinking of the Deepwater Horizon and the deaths of 11 workers; 17 others were injured.
The U.S. jobless rate was 9.6 percent in 2010, and the national employment-population ratio was 58.5 percent.

2010.event: Greece Credit Rating Spurs European Debt Crisis
2010.description: Moody's downgraded Greece's government bonds Thursday casting further doubt that the debt-laden country will be able to meet its May 19 deadline for refinancing.
During the general mayhem, exiles from the Uzbek minority claim they were assaulted and driven to Uzbekistan, with some 400,000 Kyrgyzstani citizens becoming internally displaced.
The 2010 FIFA World Cup was the 19th FIFA World Cup, the world championship for men's national association football teams that took place in South Africa.
Pop boyband One Direction (1D) was formed by music mogul Simon Cowell in 2010 during an episode of the British singing competition series, 'The X Factor.'
The Pakistan Meteorological Department reported nationwide rain totals 70 percent above normal in July and 102 percent above normal in August.
A collapse of the main ramp into the San Jose mine leaves 33 miners trapped 2,300 feet underground.

2010.event: Hide Your Kids, Hide Your Wife
2010.description: Meme Goes Viral: He's climbin' in your windows, he's snatchin' your people up.

2010.event: Rent is Too Damn High Political Party
2010.description: The Rent Is Too Damn High Party is a political party nominated candidates for governor and senator in 2010.

2010.event: Taylor Swift Releases Speak Now Album
2010.description: Billboards 2010 album of the year
For the first time, scientists have trapped antimatter atoms.
There are no fewer than 251287 cables from more than 250 US embassies around the world, obtained by WikiLeaks.

2011.description: A series of anti-government protests, uprisings, and armed rebellions that spread across much of the Islamic world.
The Egyptian revolution of 2011, also known as the January 25 Revolution, started on 25 January 2011 and spread across Egypt.
The tsunami swept the Japanese mainland and killed 15,899 people through drowning and blunt trauma.

2011.event: Osama bin Laden Killed by US Special Forces
2011.description: Osama bin Laden, the founder and first leader of the Islamist terrorist group, Al-Qaeda, was killed in Pakistan on May 2, 2011, shortly after 1:00 am PKT.
The 2011 Norway attacks were two sequential domestic terrorist attacks by Anders Behring Breivik, in which 77 people were killed.
On October 31, 2011, a particularly special person will be born—the seven billionth human alive, according to United Nations demographers.

2011.event: Game of Thrones Premieres on HBO
2011.description: Game of Thrones is an American fantasy drama television series on HBO. It is an adaptation of A Song of Ice and Fire, George R. R. Martin's series.

2011.event: Prince William and Catherine Middleton Marry
2011.description: The wedding of Prince William and Catherine Middleton took place on 29 April 2011 at Westminster Abbey in London, United Kingdom.
Occupy Wall Street was a protest movement that began on September 17, 2011, against economic inequality.
The 2011-2017 California drought was one of the most intense droughts in California history.
It ended the controversial policy in place since 1993 that allowed LGBTQ to serve only if they kept their sexual orientation secret.
Steven Paul Jobs was an American inventor, designer and entrepreneur who was the co-founder, chief executive and chairman of Apple Computer.
Amy Winehouse died of alcohol poisoning after binge drinking at the age of 27.

2011.event: North Korea's Kim Jong II Dies of Heart Attack
2011.description: The presenter Ri Chun-hee announced that he had died on 17 December at 8:30 am of a massive heart attack while travelling by train to an area outside Pyongyang.
Actress Elizabeth Taylor starred in films like 'Cat on a Hot Tin Roof' and 'Butterfield 8' but was just as famous for her violet eyes and scandalous love life.
Friday went viral for it wrong reasons - dubbed 'the worst song ever'.
Viral video of a 29 year old woman hearing for the first time after a hearing implant.

2012.event: FBI Shuts Down Hong Kong Based Megaupload
2012.description: Megaupload, one of the internet's largest file-sharing sites, has been shut down by officials in the US.
The year 2012 marked the Diamond Jubilee of Elizabeth II being the 60th anniversary of the accession of Queen Elizabeth II on 6 February 1952.
The Malian coup d'état began on 21 March when mutinying Malian soldiers rebelled in protest of the management of the Tuareg rebellion.
A mass shooting that occurred inside a Century 16 movie theater in Aurora, Colorado, during a midnight screening of the film The Dark Knight Rises.
Affected over 400 million people and was briefly the largest power outage in history by number of people affected.
Curiosity is a car-sized rover designed to explore the crater Gale on Mars as part of NASA's Mars Science Laboratory mission (MSL).

2012.event: Red Bull Skydiver Breaks Sound Barrier
2012.description: As the world watched in real time, Red Bull Stratos proved that a human could break the speed of sound in freefall.

2012.event: Barack Obama Reelected President of USA
2012.description: On November 6, 2012, Obama was re-elected for his second term as President of the United States.
The Sandy Hook Elementary School shooting occurred in Newtown, Connecticut. 20-year-old Adam Lanza shot and killed twenty 6-7 year old children and six adult staff members.
Houston was found dead at the Beverly Hilton. The coroner's report showed that she had accidentally drowned in the bathtub, heart disease and cocaine were contributing factors.
Trayvon Benjamin Martin was a 17-year-old African-American teenager from Miami Gardens, Florida, who was fatally shot in Sanford, Florida by George Zimmerman.
Facebook held its initial public offering on May 18, 2012, in what was called the 'Biggest IPO Flop Ever'.
Viral song by K-pop musician Psy is released.
Two of the members of the Russian rock protest group, were arrested and charged with hooliganism.

2012.event: Ain't Nobody Got Time for That
2012.description: Viral video created from interview of residence in an apartment fire.
A coordinated attack against two United States government facilities in Benghazi resulting in the death of US Ambassador to Lybia.
Category 5 storm was the strongest to ever hit the southern Philippine islands.

2012.event: Mayan's Predicted Day for End of the World
2012.description: Predictions that the world will end in 2012 is the most widely-disseminated doomsday tale in human history.
Inflicting nearly $70 billion (2012 USD) in damage, it was the second-costliest hurricane on record in the United States until surpassed by Hurricanes Harvey and Maria in 2017.

2012.event: Here Comes Honey Boo Boo Premiers
2012.description: A reality TV show featuring the life of Toddlers and Tiaras competitor Alana, A.K.A. 'Honey Boo Boo', and her overweight family, as they live every day.
Viral video featuring overly attached girlfriend.

2013.description: Oxford Dictionaries announced that their Word of the Year for 2013 is 'selfie.'
On 12 February 2013, a spokesman for North Korea's army command said it had successfully conducted a third underground nuclear weapons test, according to the Yonhap.
Scientists make the first embryonic-stem-cell lines from human skin cells.
The city of Detroit, Michigan, filed for Chapter 9 bankruptcy on July 18, 2013

2013.event: Orange is The New Black Premiers
2013.description: Convicted of a decade old crime of transporting drug money to an ex-girlfriend, normally law-abiding Piper Chapman is sentenced to a year and a half behind bars.
Frozen is a 2013 American 3D computer-animated musical fantasy film from Disney.
Lance Armstrong has admitted for the first time that he doped to win all seven of his Tour de France titles, turning his back on years of denials.
Pope Francis elected as 266th Roman Catholic pontiff
Nelson Mandela, the former activist who overcame a nearly three-decade prison stint to become president of South Africa, passed away after years of struggling with health issues.
The Boston Marathon bombing of 2013 was a terrorist attack that took place a short distance from the finish line of the Boston Marathon.
The Guardian reported the first leak based on top-secret documents that then 29-year-old Edward Snowden stole from the National Security Agency.
Born in London, England, on July 22, 2013, Prince George is the first child of Duchess Catherine of Cambridge and Prince William of Wales.
The 2013 Dhaka garment factory collapses, killing 1,134 people.
George Zimmerman was acquitted in the shooting death of Trayvon Martin.
The launch was marred by serious technological problems, making it difficult for the public to sign up for health insurance.

Celebrity chef Paula Deen denies she's ever told racial jokes, but she did acknowledge using the 'N word,' according to her deposition in a lawsuit, resulting in the end of many brand deals, including Food Network.
Thomas and Bell launched a fundraising campaign on Kickstarter to produce the a Veronica Mars film. It attained its goal of $2 million in eleven hours.
The Chelyabinsk meteor was a superbolide that entered Earth's atmosphere over Russia damaging over 7,200 buildings.
Nature's deadliest killer takes to the skies in the ultimate gill-ty pleasure as a group of friends try to save the Santa Monica coast from shark-infested tornadoes.

2013.event: Paul Walker Killed in Car Crash
2013.description: Walker died on November 30, 2013 at the age of 40 as a passenger in a single-car crash alongside friend and driver Roger Rodas.
The former child star went into overdrive trying to kill off her Disney millstone, Hannah Montana, at the MTV Video Music Awards.
Black Lives Matter is an international activist movement, originating in the African-American community, that campaigns against violence and systemic racism towards black people.

2014.event: Ebola Epidemic Outbreak in West Africa
2014.description: The 2014 outbreak of Ebola virus in West Africa was the 'largest, most severe and most complex Ebola epidemic' in history

Malaysia Airlines Flight 370, carrying 227 passengers and 12 crew members, loses contact with air traffic control less than an hour after taking off from Kuala Lumpur then veers off course and disappears.
The Ukrainian revolution of 2014 took place in Ukraine, when a series of violent events involving protesters, riot police, and unknown shooters in the capital, Kiev.

2014.event: 276 Women and Girls Held Hostage in Nigeria
2014.description: On the night of 14–15 April 2014, 276 female students were kidnapped from the Secondary School in the town of Chibok in Borno State, Nigeria.

Inadequate treatment and testing of the water resulted in a series of major water quality and health issues for Flint residents—issues that were chronically ignored, overlooked, and discounted by government officials.

2014.event: Michael Brown Shot in Ferguson, MO
2014.description: Michael Brown Jr., an 18-year-old African American man, was fatally shot by 28-year-old white Ferguson police officer Darren Wilson in the city of Ferguson, Missouri.
A series of sit-in street protests, often called the Umbrella Revolution and sometimes used interchangeably with Umbrella Movement resulting in 470 injuries.
The new tower replaced the Twin Towers and surrounding complex, which were destroyed by terrorist attacks on September 11, 2001
Six gunmen affiliated with the Tehrik-i-Taliban Pakistan (TTP) conducted a terrorist attack on the Army Public School killing 149 people including 132 school children.
Maya Angelou, a novelist, actress and educator, died at age 86.

2014.event: Philip Seymour Hoffman Dies of Overdose
2014.description: Hoffman died of combined drug intoxication.
Robin Williams' death was ruled a suicide, Marin County officials confirmed on Friday.
In 2014, Russia seized Crimea from Ukraine in an illegal move.

2014.event: Bill Cosby Rape Scandal Grows to 50 Accusers
2014.description: More than 50 women have accused Cosby of sexual assault.

2014.event: Eric Garner Choked by Police Officer
2014.description: Eric Garner died in Staten Island after an NYPD officer put him in a chokehold while arresting him.
The Colorado Amendment 64, which was passed by voters on November 6, 2012, led to legalization in January 2014.
Overloaded ferry flipped and drowned hundreds.
$115 million in donations were raised through the 2014 ALS Ice Bucket Challenge.

2014.event: Pharrell's Happy becomes #1 Song of Year
2014.description: ...Because I'm happy...

2014.event: But That's None of My Business Meme
2014.description: The earliest known Kermit image macro including the phrase “that’s none of my business” was highlighted by the @kermitbelike Instagram feed.

2015.event: China Announces End to One-Child Policy
2015.description: Chinese news agency Xinhua announced plans of the government to abolish the one-child policy.
The conference negotiated the Paris Agreement, a global agreement on the reduction of climate change.

2015.event: US Supreme Court Legalizes Same Sex Marriage
2015.description: The U.S. Supreme Court struck down all state bans on same-sex marriage, legalized it in all fifty states.

2015.event: Canada's Prime Minister Appoints Gender-Equal Cabinet
2015.description: Justin Trudeau presents his first cabinet which is made up of an equal number of men and women.
Three decades after the Empire's defeat, a new threat arises in the militant First Order.

2015.event: Uptown Funk Reigns Charts For Entire Year
2015.description: Bruno Mars' smash leads for a 14th week, equaling the second-longest reign in the chart's history.
Tumblr user swiked posted a photograph of a dress asking the science side of Tumblr to help identify its colors.
Cupertino releases the Apple Watch, the wearable device Tim Cook describes as the 'next chapter in Apple history.'
Nine people were shot and killed during a Bible study session at Emanuel African Methodist Episcopal Church in Charleston, South Carolina.
Twelve people were killed in a terror attack at the offices of Charlie Hebdo, a French satirical magazine that has published controversial Muhammad cartoons.

2015.event: NYT Breaks Story About Hillary Clinton Emails
2015.description: Mrs Clinton's email system became a national story the first week of March 2015, when the New York Times ran a front-page article on the subject.
Hundreds of thousands of people have fled across the Mediterranean Sea this year to escape war and persecution.

2015.event: Letterman Retires from the Late Show
2015.description: David Letterman will end his run as host of The Late Show on Wednesday, May 20, 2015.
New findings from NASA's Mars Reconnaissance Orbiter (MRO) provide the strongest evidence yet that liquid water flows.

2015.event: Caitlyn Jenner Comes Out as Transgendered
2015.description: Assigned male at birth, Caitlyn Jenner publicly came out as a trans woman in April 2015.
Shia LaBeouf 'Just Do It' Motivational Speech (Original Video by LaBeouf, Rönkkö & Turner)

2016.description: The U.S. announced its re-opening of relations with Cuba in December 2014, ending a Cold War stalemate that had been in place since 1959.
The Panama Papers are a leak of 11.5m files showing the myriad ways in which the rich can exploit secretive offshore tax regimes.
The Paris Agreement opened for signature on 22 April 2016 – Earth Day – at UN Headquarters in New York.
Britons voted to leave the European Union.
Donald Trump, a New York real estate developer and former reality television star, was elected president of the United States.
Lemonade is the sixth studio album by American singer Beyoncé, released on April 23, 2016, by Parkwood Entertainment and Columbia Records.

2016.event: Bob Dylan Recieves Nobel Prize for Literature
2016.description: Mr. Dylan, 75, is the first musician to win the award.
After 108 years of waiting, the Cubs won the 2016 World Series with a wild 8-7, 10-inning Game 7 victory over the Indians.

2016.event: Simone Biles Wins in Olympic Games in Rio
2016.description: Simone Biles wins gold in the floor and individual all-around, silver in the vault and bronze on the beam, and finished fourth on the uneven bars.

2016.event: Hamilton Wins Big at Tony Awards
2016.description: 'Hamilton' won 11 Tony Awards including best musical.
Russian government hackers penetrated the computer network of the Democratic National Committee and gained access to the entire database.
The Aleppo bombings (April–July 2016) were intense bombardments on both rebel and government-held areas in the city of Aleppo, Syria.
Zika is spread mostly by the bite of an infected Aedes species mosquito.

2016.event: President Declares State of Emergency in Flint
2016.description: President Obama declares emergency in Flint where the city switched water sources, causing pipe corrosion and ultimately filling the city's water supply with high levels of lead.
Mass shooting took place at the Pulse nightclub in Orlando, Florida, leaving 49 people dead.
David Bowie Dies at 69 from cancer.
Toxicology tests concluded Prince died from an accidental overdose of the opioid fentanyl.
In the early hours of 25 December 2016, Michael was found dead at his home in Goring-on-Thames, Oxfordshire aged 53.

2016.event: Carrie Fisher Dies from Heart Attack
2016.description: Carrie Fisher passed away from a heart attack. Her mother, Debbie Reynolds, dies one day later.

2016.event: Philando Castile Shot by Cop Recorded on Facebook Live
2016.description: Video Live Streamed Over Facebook Shows the Moments After a Black Man Was Shot Dead By Police.

2016.event: Dallas Police Shot and Killed in Retaliation
2016.description: The heavily armed sniper who gunned down police officers in downtown Dallas, leaving five of them dead, specifically set out to kill as many white officers as he could.

2016.event: Brock Turner Sentenced to 6 Months for Rape
2016.description: Widespread outrage has erupted over a California judge's decision to give a former Stanford University swimmer a six-month jail sentence for sexually assaulting an unconscious woman.

2016.event: Pizzagate | Fake News Spreads on Social Media
2016.description: 'Pizzagate' is a debunked conspiracy theory that went viral during the 2016 United States presidential election cycle, resulting in gun violence, highlighting the dangers of fake news.

2016.event: Standing Rock and the Dakota Access Pipeline Protests
Pokemon Go Captures the World's Attention
2016.description: Pokemon Go takes the world by storm, downloaded more than 750 million times in the first year.

2016.event: Grace VanderWaal Debuts on America's Got Talent
2016.description: A 12-year-old ukulele player gets the golden buzzer on America's Got Talent when she takes a risk and performs an original tune, 'I Don't Know My Name.'

2016.event: Kaepernick Opts to Take a Knee
2016.description: San Francisco 49ers quarterback Colin Kaepernick knelt during the national anthem in protest of 'wrongdoings against minorities'.
Danielle Peskowitz Bregoli (aka Bhad Bhabie) becomes famous for catch phrase uttered on Dr. Phil.

2017.description: Emmanuel Macron defeated Marine Le Pen to win the French presidency. At just 39, Macron is France's youngest leader ever.
North Korea successfully test-launched its first intercontinental ballistic missile, according to U.S. officials. This was one of many missle and nuclear tests performed by North Korea in 2017.
Harvey Weinstein paid off sexual harassment accusers for decades

2017.event: Alyssa Milano's Tweet Begins 'Me Too' Era
2017.description: Alyssa Milano starts the #metoo conversation with this tweet: 'If you’ve been sexually harassed or assaulted write ‘me too’ as a reply to this tweet.'
A fire broke out in the 24-storey Grenfell Tower block of flats in North Kensington, West London, causing 72 deaths,
The inauguration of Donald Trump as the 45th President of the United States marked commencement of the term of Donald Trump as President.

2017.event: Trump Fires FBI Director James Comey
2017.description: Comey had been criticized in 2016 for his handling of the FBI's investigation of the Hillary Clinton email controversy and in 2017 for the FBI's investigation of Russian interference in the 2016 U.S. elections.

2017.event: Terroist Bombing at Ariana Grande Concert
2017.description: Children were among the 22 people killed in a suicide attack after an Ariana Grande concert at Britain's Manchester Arena.

2017.event: Unite the Right Rally in Charlottesville
2017.description: Several hundred white nationalists and white supremacists marched Friday as part of a Unite the Right rally at the University of Virginia that left 1 dead.
The first coast-to-coast solar eclipse in almost 100 years moved across the U.S. at 2,000 mph on Aug. 21.
On the night of October 1, 2017, Stephen Paddock opened fire on a crowd of concertgoers at the Route 91 Harvest music festival on the Las Vegas Strip in Nevada. He killed 58 people and wounded 413.

2017.event: da Vinci Painting Sells for $450 Million
2017.description: Leonardo da Vinci painting sells for world record $450 million, shattering the record for the most expensive artwork ever sold.
Hurricane Maria was a deadly Category 5 hurricane that devastated Dominica, the St Croix, and Puerto Rico. Total fatalities: 3,057
On January 21, 2017, the day after the inauguration of President Donald Trump, the Women's March was a worldwide protest.

2017.event: House Republicans Repeal Most of Affordable Care Act
2017.description: The United States House of Representatives voted to pass the American Health Care Act (and thereby repeal most of the Affordable Care Act) by a narrow margin of 217 to 213

2017.event: Special Counsel Investigation of Russian Interference
2017.description: Former FBI director Robert Mueller appointed as special counsel to investigate possible collusion between the Trump campaign and Russia.

2017.event: Trump Signs Travel Ban Executive Order
2017.description: Executive Order 13769, titled Protecting the Nation from Foreign Terrorist Entry into the United States, aka Muslim ban or travel ban, was an executive order by United States president Donald Trump.

2017.event: Serena Williams Wins Australian Open While Pregnant
2017.description: The tennis champion was nearly two months pregnant when she won her 23rd Grand Slam.
Before she was Wonder Woman, she was Diana, princess of the Amazons, trained to be an unconquerable warrior.
Despacito is a song by Puerto Rican singer Luis Fonsi featuring Puerto Rican rapper Daddy Yankee.
A viral game in which players pretend that the floor is lava and proceed to climb on furniture or other objects to keep their feet off the ground.

2017.event: TIME's Trump Cover Notes Choas in White House
2017.description: After several firings, resignations, and delays in filling cabinet positions, Trump's new presidency is on shaky ground. The depiction follows the convergence of multiple distressing storylines for the president this week.

2018.event: US 'Zero Tolerance Policy' on Immigration
2018.description: Attorney General Jeff Sessions announces a 'zero tolerance” policy at the southwest border. The policy change leads to the separation of families because children cannot be held in a detention facility with their parents.

2018.event: Over 700 Families Separated at Border
2018.description: The New York Times publishes a report that says more than 700 children have been taken from their parents since October, 100 of those under the age of 4.

2018.event: First Monkey Clones Reported
2018.description: Scientists in China report creation of the first monkey clones in the journal 'Cell'. The two primates are named Zhong Zhong and Hua Hua.

2018.event: Lunar Eclipse, Super Blue Blood Moon
2018.description: A total lunar eclipse occurred on January 31, 2018.

2018.event: Winter Olympics
2018.description: 2018 Winter Olympics held in PyeongChang, Republic of Korea.

2018.event: School Shooting at Marjory Stoneman Douglas HS
2018.description: A shooting at Marjory Stoneman Douglas High School in Parkland, Florida, leaves at least 17 people dead.

2018.event: Former Russian Double Agent & Daughter Poisoned
2018.description: Former Russian Double Agent, Sergei Skripal, and his daughter Yulia Skripal, who was visiting him from Moscow, were poisoned with a Novichok nerve agent.

2018.event: National School Walkout
2018.description: One month after the school shooting tragedy at Marjory Stoneman Douglas HS, students from across the country participated in a National School Walkout in hopes that students will never experience gun violence in school again.

2018.event: 70 Killed in Syria Chemical Attack
2018.description: At least 70 people were killed in Douma, the last rebel-held town in Syria’s Eastern Ghouta in a suspected chemical attack.

2018.event: Kim Jong-un Crosses DMZ
2018.description: North Korean leader Kim Jong Un has crossed the line dividing the demilitarized zone to meet with South Korean President Moon Jae-in in what's being described as a historic summit.

2018.event: Royal Wedding: Prince Harry and Meghan Markle
2018.description: Meghan and Harry's wedding ceremony took place at St. George's Chapel at Windsor Castle with an estimated 1.9 billion viewers.

2018.event: Ireland Repeals Abortion Ban
2018.description: Irish voters repealed a constitutional amendment that banned abortion in nearly all cases, laying the groundwork for a legal path to terminating pregnancies in the predominantly Catholic country.

2018.event: Lower Puna Volcanic Eruption Destroys Homes
2018.description: In 2018, a new eruption of Kīlauea volcano changed the island of Hawai‘i forever. From May through August, large lava flows covered land southeast of the park destroying over 700 homes and devastating residential areas in the Puna District.

2018.event: Canada Legalizes Cannabis for Recreational Use
2018.description: Recreational marijuana use will soon be legal in Canada after the Senate passed a 'historic' bill on Tuesday with a vote of 52-29. Canada is only the second country in the world -- and the first G7 nation -- to implement legislation to permit a nationwide marijuana market.

2018.event: Saudi Arabia Allows Women to Drive
2018.description: Saudi Arabia lifted its widely criticized ban on female drivers on Sunday, sparking jubilation among many women in the country who went out on the roads shortly after the ban was lifted.

2018.event: US Tariffs on Chinese Goods, Sparks Trade War
2018.description: U.S. tariffs on US$ 34 billion of Chinese goods come into effect, as President Trump suggests the final total could reach $550bn. China accuses the U.S. of starting the 'largest trade war in economic history' and announces immediate retaliatory tariffs

2018.event: Kerala Floods
2018.description: Severe floods affected the south Indian state Kerala, due to unusually high rainfall during the monsoon season. Over 483 people died, and 140 are missing.

2018.event: Brett Kavanaugh Confirmed to Supreme Court
2018.description: Despite sexual assault claim and related controversy, the Repubican controlled Senate confirms President Trumps pick for the US Supreme Court.

2018.event: Zuckerberg Testifies Before Senate
2018.description: Zuckerberg testified before a joint session of the Senate commerce and judiciary committees on how Facebook has handled user data and faced efforts to subvert democracy.

2018.event: Wildfires Ignites in California
2018.description: 2019 California wildfires. The 2019 wildfire season is the current-running fire season in California, United States. As of December 22, 2019, over 6,876 fires have been recorded according to Cal Fire and the US Forest Service, totaling an estimated of 253,214 acres (102,472 ha) of burned land.

2018.event: Longest US Gov Shutdown in History Begins
2018.description: The United States government enters a second government shutdown, arising over a dispute over funding for the U.S.–Mexico border wall. The shutdown, which lasted until January 25, 2019, is the longest government shutdown in U.S. history.

2018.event: BTS become First K-pop Group on Billboard
2018.description: South Korean boy band BTS are the first K-pop group to top the US Billboard 200 with their album 'Love Yourself: Tear'

2018.event: Senator John McCain Dies
2018.description: John S. McCain, the proud naval aviator who climbed from depths of despair as a prisoner of war in Vietnam to pinnacles of power as a Republican congressman and senator from Arizona and a two-time contender for the presidency, died on Saturday at his home in Arizona. He was 81.

2018.event: Unemployment Rate Lowest Since 1969
2018.description: The unemployment rate fell to 3.7% in September, the lowest level since December 1969.

2018.event: Historic Election for Women of Color
2018.description: Already in 2018, women candidates have broken the records for the number of candidates for governor, U.S. House and U.S. Senate. And that trend continued in the 2018 midterm elections.

2018.event: Crazy Rich Asians Movie Released in Canada
2018.description: This contemporary romantic comedy, based on a global bestseller, follows native New Yorker Rachel Chu to Singapore to meet her boyfriend's family.

2018.event: Black Panther Released
2018.description: T'Challa, heir to the hidden but advanced kingdom of Wakanda, must step forward to lead his people into a new future and must confront a challenger from his country's past.

2018.event: Childish Gambino Releases This is America
2018.description: Childish Gambino aka Donald Glover releases the music video to new single 'This is America'.

2019.description: US grounds all Boeing 737 Max aircraft after bans by others countries following the plane type's second crash in Ethiopia

2019.event: School Children Walkout for Climate Strike
2019.description: An estimated 1.4 million young people in 123 countries skipped school Friday to demand stronger climate policies in what may be one of the largest environmental protests in history.
Over 1 million people protest in Hong Kong over proposed new extradition laws to China in one of largest-ever protests in the city.
On 24 July 2019, the day following Johnson's election as Conservative Party leader, Queen Elizabeth II accepted Theresa May's resignation and appointed Johnson as prime minister.

2019.event: Donald Trump becomes Third Impeached President
2019.description: Donald Trump has become the third president in United States history to be impeached on 19 December 2019 after the House of Representatives voted to impeach him for high crimes and misdemeanors.

2019.event: All Five Major Beauty Queens are Black Women
2019.description: For the first time in the history of beauty pageants, all five major title holders (Miss Universe, Miss World, Miss America, Miss USA and Miss Teen USA) are Black women.

The Christchurch mosque shootings were two consecutive terrorist shooting attacks at mosques in Christchurch, New Zealand, during Friday Prayer on 15 March 2019. The attacks killed 51 people and injured 49.

On Easter Sunday, three churches in Sri Lanka and three luxury hotels in the commercial capital Colombo were targeted in a coordinated terrorist suicide bombings. 259 people were killed and 500+ injured.
A fire broke out beneath the roof of Notre-Dame de Paris cathedral in Paris destroying the building's spire and most of its roof.

Kylie Jenner, 21, is reportedly now worth $1 billion. That makes her the youngest billionaire in history, and the youngest self-made billionaire ever, according to Forbes, which included Jenner on its list of the world's billionaires, released on Tuesday.
Avengers: Endgame released. To become highest grossing movie of all time.
Scandal involving efforts by U.S. President Donald Trump to coerce Ukraine into providing damaging information about potential campaign rival, Joe Biden.

2019.event: NOAA Reports July 2019 Hottest Month on Record
2019.description: The National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA) reports, on August 15, that July 2019 was the hottest month on record globally, at 0.95 °C (1.71 °F) above the 20th-century average.

2019.event: 'El Chapo' Sentenced to Life in Prison
2019.description: Joaquín 'El Chapo' Guzmán, former head of the Sinaloa Cartel, which became the biggest supplier of drugs to the U.S., is sentenced to life in prison plus 30 years.

The 2019 Amazon rainforest wildfires season saw a year-to-year surge in fires occurring in the Amazon rainforest and Amazon biome within Brazil, Bolivia, Paraguay, and Peru during that year's Amazonian tropical dry season.

2019.event: Luke Perry Dies of a Stroke
2019.description: Perry suffered a massive ischemic stroke at his home in Sherman Oaks, Los Angeles on February 27, 2019. After a second stroke, his family followed the medical team's recommendations to remove him from life support, and he died on March 4 at age 52.
The YouTube stars launched their highly anticipated Conspiracy collection on Friday and, within minutes, Star's site crashed thanks to the rush of people trying to buy the products.
Elon Musk's latest pet project, the Cybertruck, was unveiled to the masses on Nov. 21.
Carano told Vanity Fair that Baby Yoda brought warmth to a show that focused on a character who prides himself on his coolness, on his lack of feeling.
